author: rundog
title: Streaming Cardano based games
description: There are many gaming projects being developed on cardano. But not many people see them. So i would like to change that.

f6_assessments.q0: I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge F8: Gamers On - Chained by proposing livestreams of Cardano blockchain games. They propose 4 livestreams on youtube or twitch platform highlighting different Cradano games bringing more attention to games on the Cradnao blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer doesn't make his experience in gaming or streaming available nor does he mention having a following already established in said livestreaming platforms which would help with providing greater exposure to the Cardano blockchain games.
f6_assessments.q2: Although the proposer presents some metrics for success I do not believe the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. Furthermore the number of viewers mentioned as a goal is too small an audience to make any significant difference in the goal of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the challenge of creating notoriety within the Cardano Gaming community. Offering the solution of  live streaming through popular platforms such as Twitch and Youtube, while also suggesting the use of community based social media platforms such as Discord, Reddit, Telegram and Twitter.
f6_assessments.q1: The success rate of this proposal, due to the inherent nature of streaming, is a tricky question to answer. Many streamers succeed, many do not, it's difficult to tell what kind of game or streamer will blow up in popularity. With the information given however it appears that the proposer has extensive experience with gaming (league of legends, Counter strike: Global offensive), some experience with streaming and hosting small events "Have organized small scale streams before." The proposer however fails to describe any member of their team, instead making a promise to "...get everything needed..." Furthermore the proposer does not elaborate on the use of budgeted funds "32 hours on stream research and stream setup = 640$" (What materials are needed in stream setup, why does stream research need an income? What specifically does stream research entail?) "8 hours of streaming = 240$" Earlier in the proposal it is mentioned that the proposer would be streaming during their free time, but otherwise why then would it merit payment? Why does streaming for 8 hours justify payment?
f6_assessments.q2:
Unfortunately with the information given, I have deduced that the information provided is not enough to audit the proposal. The purpose of this proposal is to bring notoriety and discussion to Cardano gaming "Success in the project would be finding lots of good and playable games built on cardano. That would fill up livestream time with good fun..." This statement betrays the focus of the proposed challenge. Finally this proposals view of success is rather generous "5 viewers per livestream

10 views on the VODs." These are very low numbers, I do not think this proposal justifies an audit.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to attract more people to Cardano games but I find it is not really promising.  First of all, I would like to know more about statistics around the community's interest in Cardano games to better understand how the project aligns with the current situation. Proposer set up an objective of only 8 hours of streaming a month (not including VOD) and have no social media followings, I don't think the stream will attract any audience, thus no impact on the community.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer stated that he has social media followings, but in the feasibility section there is still no specific marketing strategy to attract audience. Information about budget usage is also questionable. 32 hours of stream research and stream setup is relatively long, since he said he has experience in organizing small-scale streams before. For these reasons, I think the proposer does not have a reliable strategy and experience in streaming to make the project feasible.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer has provided attainable KPIs to achieve, but too small to make any impact to the community. 
I also suggest to keep tracks of some other metrics:
Number of feedbacks, comments
Ratio between positive/negative feedbacks.

f6_assessments.q0: The project addresses the problem that very few people are currently streaming games on the Cardano platform. I understand that blockchain technology is decentralized, so in this case, who will be anonymous: streamer or viewer? If neither the streamer nor the viewer leaves their identity because of the decentralization of the blockchain, then this streaming platform is different from existing platforms like Youtube, Facebook, Twitch. And what is the user attraction of this platform, and how does it compete with other platforms?
f6_assessments.q1: The project mentions beneficial experiences in this game field. I believe this will be a plus point for the project to gain the trust of other stakeholders. The project has also provided a detailed plan for each day. However, I realize that this plan is only a short-term plan. The project should prepare a longer-term plan to assess the likelihood of success. If there is no specific plan, the project can refer to weekly, monthly, and quarterly activities.
f6_assessments.q2: Specific plans have also been mentioned, although short. Detailed budget analysis was also mentioned. Although the work items were few, the commendable point is that the project has estimated the costs for these activities precisely. If it is possible to provide more ways in which the project discloses the spending of these items, the transparency of the project will be more appreciated.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is an important proposal which will benefit Cardano and also the game developers on cardano as they will need all the word out .
I like the fact that the proposal highlighted the problem of low quality blockchain games or games that are not fun to play and tried to offer some solution which is great.
I have one question though, what language will the stream be in and if it is in english, will other languages be considered in the future? i am asking this because the cardano community is a global one with people speaking different languages.
This is a very short but important proposal,I am giving 5 star for impact.

f6_assessments.q0: Pretty simple idea, that could have a good benefit down the line. Streaming games based on Cardano for promotion purposes. At this point, there aren't a lot of games on Cardano but the trend of developing new ones is increasing and this could be a good starting point to attract people to easily find games that could be interesting to them.
f6_assessments.q1: The implementation of proposal is not difficult, and I don't see any roadblocks with that. Streaming should be simple to do, only choosing right games is what needs to be done. Info on the proposer is scarce, so this would be more of a trust based challenge. The amount requested is relatively small so it is a low risk proposal. One problem would be, how to promote this streaming service? There is no point in making it if no one is following or watching. Maybe if this proposal would get green light community could assist in promotion as it would benefit all. Especially people behind developing games.
f6_assessments.q2: The only way to audit the success of this is to see how many people will be watching the broadcast, hopefully they will then participate in new games and therefore use Cardano. But, difficult to say how many people that would be watching the stream would participate in games. The bigger the exposure, the higher chance. Therefore, community assistance would be beneficial.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal clearly identifies a problem within the challenge that must be resolved and that clearly adds value, it is a practical, economical and viable idea. At the same time, this proposal can be extended to other challenges and give it continuity.
f6_assessments.q1:
Although the evidence can be improved and complemented, clear skills and experience in the subject are observed. The proponent himself is the one who will develop the proposal, which facilitates its monitoring and it is observed that it is sufficient to address the challenges.
The budget is sufficient and is described in a concise and clear manner, it is reasonable. A simple and easy to understand proposal is observed. At the same time, the proposed schedule is quite realistic, the implementation plan is adequate and very practical.
It would be important to improve a little on the practical aspects of the proposal, pointing out more relevant aspects such as architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for the implementation.
 At the level of risk, its impact on the proposal is relevant and makes one reflect on the impact. This greatly affects the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are clear and define the success of the proposal, there is at the same time a clear description of the objective problem. The solution to address the problem could be refined.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal intends to attract gamers to the Cardano platform by doing a series of live streams of Cardano based games on social media platforms. If successful, the proposal would bring awareness to Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem and could attract gamers and in turn gaming developers which could increase Cardanos overall share in the gaming market. Therefore, the proposal is valid and addresses the challenge. 
Overall, in a very social media driven world, the proposal has potential to be very successful and beneficial to the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem. Additionally, it has the ability to be scaled to become an exclusively Cardano based game streaming channel.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does have extensive experience in gaming and some experience in streaming however, there is no profile or previous streams to verify these facts . The proposer has given a reasonable timeline and budget breakdown to undertake the work. They have indicated the risks and mitigations however, one particular risk is their lack of social media followings, I don't believe the mitigation in this case is sufficient. I believe in order to have a significant impact the proposer would need to have an already established following as they will struggle to attract the necessary views in an already saturated market. To gain the required following it's likely the proposer would require further funding in the future, which has not been mentioned.
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPIs mentioned (number of views on streams) do not fully align with the challenge KPIs but it is indicative of the success of the proposal. Additional KPIs could be:

- Increase in gaming proposals on Catalyst
- Increase in number of gaming based apps
- Increase in content creators  

The timeline is short term and doesn't provide any indication if the proposer intents to continue the work/apply for further funding if successful
